metadata.title: CVE-2021-39254 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A crafted NTFS image can cause an integer overflow in memmove, leading to aheap-based buffer overflow in the function ntfs_attr_record_resize, inNTFS-3G < 2021.8.22.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-39254` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntfs-3g - 1:2015.3.14AR.1-1ubuntu0.3+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ntfs-3g package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2015.3.14AR.1-1ubuntu0.3+esm1').
